Am I supposed to happily eat stew and pretend I'm not your prisoner?!"</mc><br><br> Completely unfazed, she takes her time to finish chewing. <w>"Yes."</w><br><br> Your fist grows tighter and your jaw clenches more, <mc>"I swear I will…"</mc><br><br> <w>"Oh shut up."</w> she cuts you off with a command, her spells compelling you to silence. <w>"You will eat your stew silently."</w> her words come slow and angry.<br><br> <w>"I didn't have to do this you know. I could have erased your mind, left you a drooling mess. I could have turned you into a frog. No, I instead chose to keep you here in hopes I can change your mind."</w><br><br> <w>"You call me unjust, a monster, <i>YOU</i> were the one who broke into my house looking to <i>KILL</i> me!"</w> she slams down her spoon, and looks away, tired and upset.<br><br> After a few moments, she lets out a long sigh. <w>"I was so looking forward to fucking you half the night, but I'm too upset now. Finish up and sleep down here. You can speak again in the morning."</w><br><br> She sulks off upstairs, leaving you alone with your thoughts and a pile of dishes.<br><br> <<link "Go to sleep" "SleepDown">><</link>> </div></div><<set $faceMood = "angry.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<display "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><<print '<img src="resources/npcs/wytch/' + $wytchWear + '.png"/>'>><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/smirk.png"></div> <<set $rel += 1>> You sit silently, with her eyes on you, realizing that she will wait for you to answer. You grumble out a low, <mc>"Fine."</mc><br><br> She smiles at you, <w>"So talkative. Well, I for one had a great day. I visited the blacksmith&#39;s son. Let me tell you, he is not only good at pounding iron."</w> She finishes with the wink of her heavily made-up lashes.<br><br> You almost choke on a bite of dinner at her lack of decorum, which she finds hilarious, laughing loudly at the far end of the table.<br><br> <w>"Oh, Blackwolf, you're so easy to rattle, it's adorable!"</w><br><br> You clench your jaw and shoot her a stare...before realizing she's absolutely right, and just did it again. This makes you even angrier inside, but you choose to choke it down, and instead focus on your stew.<br><br> She smiles at your restraint, <w>"I think this is going to work out fine."</w><br><br> You look back up with a cocked eyebrow, <mc>"Fine?"</mc><br><br> She explains, <w>"You see, when some [airquotes] <i>hero</i> shows up to kill one of us, we usually just erase them, or change them into a frog or a book or something."</w><br><br> She pauses to take a mouthful of stew, then continues talking while chewing it, <w>"But that always seemed so excessive to me, I wondered if I could try rehabilitation instead. You, Blackwolf, are my experiment."</w><br><br> <w>"After all,"</w> she swallows and points the spoon at you accusingly, <w>"you came here to kill me, I think you're getting off easy."</w><br><br> The gravity of your situation washes over you, leaving you to sheepishly eat the rest of your stew in silence.<br><br> Eventually, your bowls are empty, and your bellies are full.<br><br> <<if $dessert == true>> <w>"Ah! I do make a mean stew! Now that dinner is done my lovely Blackwolf...I think it's time for dessert."</w><br><br> <<set $WytchSatisfaction = 0>> <<link "Dessert" "Dessert">><</link>> <<else>> <w>"Ah! I do make a mean stew! Please clean up down here, and come to bed when finished."</w><br><br> With that she leaves the mess and dishes as they are and heads upstairs. You finish cleaning and head up yourself later.<br><br> <<link "Clean up then go upstairs to bed" "SleepUp">><</link>> <</if>> </div></div><<set $faceMood = "smile-1.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<display "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><<print '<img src="resources/npcs/wytch/' + $wytchWear + '.png"/>'>><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/smirk.png"></div> <<set $rel += 1>> You cautiously examine her expression for sarcasm, but it seems a genuine question.<br><br> <mc>"Not so bad, the chores weren't very hard."</mc><br><br> She lights up considerably at your reply, <w>"See! I knew this would work out!"</w><br><br> <mc>"Work out?"</mc><br><br> She nods, <w>"You see, when some [airquotes] <i>hero</i> shows up to kill one of us, we usually just erase them, or change them into an animal or an object."</w><br><br> She pauses to take a mouthful of stew, then continues talking while chewing it, <w>"But that always seemed so excessive to me, I wondered if I could try rehabilitation instead of turning you into a frog."</w><br><br> The gravity of your situation washes over you, as it dawns on you what could have been.<br><br> She sees your expression drop, and laughs again, <w>"Don't worry, I've never been into that frog thing. I have much more interesting kinks."</w><br><br> <<if $dessert == true>> Her expression changes into that sly smile and seductive eyes, <w>"Speaking of which, I've had enough dinner, how about a little dessert?"</w><br><br> <<set $WytchSatisfaction = 0>> <<link "Dessert" "Dessert">><</link>> <<else>> <w>"But that's for another day (wink). Let's see if we can't give Hans a little more eye candy while we're at it."</w><br><br> <<change>> <<set $woodsmanSuki += 1>> <<else>> <cap>$MissNic</cap> raises an eyebrow, <w>"Oh? Confused, you watch as she leans down and whispers something into the pot. That same unearthly wind blows around the room and swirls over the pot. It shakes violently as the contents inside jump and convulse. In a few short moments, the whole cabin is filled with the delicious smell of warm stew. Despite a dozen demonstrations in the past day, you're still amazed at her magic.<br><br> <</if>> You grab a couple of bowls and silverware and serve portions for each of you, while she plops down in her chair with a bounce.<br><br> <w>"I'm so hungry! So what is it you wanted to know?"</w><br><br> <mc>"I suppose I should start with your real name."</mc><br><br> Her face turns a little shy, then after a short pause, <w>"Cassandra. Cassandra Smith."</w><br><br> You burst out laughing, <mc>"Smith?"</mc><br><br> <w>"Hey, don't laugh! What's wrong with Smith?"</w><br><br> <mc>"Nothing, nothing wrong...it's just, so normal. I expected something more, I don't know...magical? Like...Starloom or Emberflower or something like that."</mc><br><br> She snerks in laughter along with you, <w>"<i>Starloom?</i> I'll take normal any day over that. Besides, we can't all be as blessed with nicknames as The Blackwolf."</w><br><br> <mc>"Oh, I don't know, the Scarlet Wytch isn't bad at all."</mc><br><br> She stops laughing as her smile fades, and she stares down into her stew. <w>"No, I suppose not."</w><br><br> You're not sure why, but you can see she isn't a fan of her title.<br><br> [[Try to Empathize]]<br> [[Play it off]]<br> </div></div> <<set $decision = "Dinner-NameDecision">> <<set $dinnerThis = "">> <<set $dinnerUp = "Dinner-Hunted">> <<set $dinnerDown = "Dinner-BadJob">> <<set $relLvl = 1>> /* Relationship Levels: -2 terrible, -1 bad, 0 neutral, 1 good, 2 great */ <<set $faceMood = "smile-2.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<display "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><<print '<img src="resources/npcs/wytch/' + $wytchWear + '.png"/>'>><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/wistful.png"></div> <mc>"I'm sorry, I didn't realize you didn't like it."</mc><br><br> <w>"Don't worry about it, it's fine. There are far worse things for wytches to be called."</w><br><br> You realize you don't know her past, and how hard things may have been for her...how hard they still might be. You find yourself sympathizing with her.<br><br> Finally after a long while thinking, you speak up softly, <mc>"Well in that case, what would you like me to call you?"</mc><br><br> The look of joy that washes over her is immense, she smiles nearly with tears in her eyes. <w>"Cassandra would be great."</w><br><br> <<if $dessert == true>> You finish dinner shortly after, and you automatically start cleaning up.<br><br> She comes up behind you and wraps her arms around your waist.<br><br> <w>"Leave that for tomorrow. Here I thought I was teaching you a lesson."</w><br><br> With that she leaves the mess and dishes as they are and heads upstairs, smiling the whole time.<br><br> <<set $rel += 4>> <<link "Head upstairs to bed" "SleepUp">><</link>> <</if>> </div></div><<set $faceMood = "sad.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<display "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><<print '<img src="resources/npcs/wytch/' + $wytchWear + '.png"/>'>><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/fuu.png"></div> Seeing she's upset, you decide to try and play it off.<br><br> <mc>"Hey! Don't worry about it, it's fine. There are far worse things for wytches to be called."</mc><br><br> <w>"Yes, that's also very true,"</w> she replies darkly.<br><br> Seems you've hit on a sore spot. You decide to play it safe and let dinner pass by in silence.<br><br> <<if $dessert == true>> When everything is finished, you automatically start cleaning up.<br><br> She comes up behind you and starts tugging at your waistband.<br><br> You turn to see that sly smile back on her face, <w>"C'mon upstairs. I need your...<i>help</i> to take my mind off things. "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> You very slowly and cautiously push the door open, careful to not let it creak.<br><br> The dimly lit interior is again average for a small cabin. A table and chairs sit across from a hearth. One window, one door, and a staircase - likely leading to the bedroom. The most notable detail you see is that it's an absolute mess. Ashes piled in the hearth; clothes, books, scrolls and dishes strewn about carelessly; it looks like it hasn't had a good cleaning in weeks or months. Abandoned?<br><br> You look around carefully and silently - no easy task among the litter all over the floor. On the table are the remnants of a bowl of soup. It has a thick skin on top, but no mold, and the coals in the hearth still have some heat. Someone was here at least a day ago, if not this morning.<br><br> As you near the staircase, you hear the quiet shuffle of fabric and creak of furniture from above. Fortune smiles, you may have caught the Wytch sleeping in bed!<br><br> [[Go upstairs|UpstairsFirst]] </div></div><<set $return = "UpstairsFirst">> <<set $faceMood = $defaultMood>> <<set $miscpic = {type:'vid', src: 'bedroom/day.mp4'}>> <<display "MISC">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <img src="resources/npcs/beryl.png" class="berylNpc npcImg" /> Step by step, at an agonizingly slow pace, you make your way up the stairs. Careful not to make the slightest sound.<br><br> …<br><br> The bedroom is small, and save for a few bookshelves and a tiny closet to the side, it is almost entirely filled by a huge, down-stuffed bed.<br><br> Sprawled out on the bed is a beautiful woman, sleeping soundly. Long and lithe limbs with a perfect balance of softness and muscle. A gently curving waist that flares out to a generous set of sensual hips. The breasts are larger than average and perky enough to point upwards even laying down. She's absolutely stunning, but she's not the Wytch.<br><br> For one thing, her hair is pink.<br><br> And her skin is purple.<br><br> And she has horns.<br><br> And a massive cock.<br><br> Your face skews up at the lewd figure before you, a demon. This might be the Wytch's familiar...or just a plaything contracted from dark powers.<br><br> She stirs slightly with a long, sensual <demon>"Mmmmmmmm"</demon><br><br> That huge appendage between her legs twitches and begins to inflate, <demon>"Mistress, you're back earl…"</demon><br><br> As her eyes flutter open she sees you, weapon raised and ready to strike. A look of surprise flashes through her eyes, before being replaced with one of fury.<br><br> <demon>"YOU WILL NOT HARM MY MISTRESS!"</demon> she shrieks at you, leaping up from the bed with inhuman speed!<br><br> Honed instinct takes over.<br><br> In an instant, she is on you. Her claws wrapped around your throat, perfect body pressed up against your armor.<br><br> The next instant she stops, your sword having found its mark - straight through her belly.<br><br> She moans again - still managing to sound wanton and lustful, even in her death throes. Flame and smoke pours out the wound and consumes her in a burst. Within seconds, it's over and the demon is banished back to her realm.<br><br> You barely have time to catch your breath when you hear a sound downstairs.<br><br> <w>"Beryl! I'm home!"</w><br><br> <mc>"Shit"</mc><br><br> [[Hide|HideFirst]] </div></div><<set $return = "HideFirst">> <<set $faceMood = $defaultMood>> <<set $miscpic = {type:'vid', src: 'bedroom/day.mp4'}>> <<display "MISC">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/work.png"><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/smirk.png"></div> You can hear her rummaging about downstairs. Followed by the sound of something breaking and a string of profanities.<br><br> <w>"Gods damn it all, we need somebody to clean this place up!"</w><br><br> You have a few seconds to hide and prepare an ambush.<br><br> Bed? Too open.<br><br> Under the bed? Not enough room, bad angle.<br><br> Closet? Closet.<br><br> There's barely enough room for you to fit, but you manage to squeeze in, leaving only the slightest crack to see out of. Just in time too, as you can hear the other person coming up the stairs.<br><br> <w>"Beryl, have you spent the whole day in bed? You'd better at least be hard and ready for me."</w><br><br> As soon as she enters, you know it's the Wytch. The descriptions match her perfectly. Beautiful, enchanting eyes, long scarlet hair, and a massive pair of perfect breasts. <br><br> She stops in confusion at not finding her companion, just a step too far for an attack. Just a little closer…<br><br> <w>"Beryl?"</w> her eyes scan the room, stopping on the cracked door of the closet. A bead of sweat forms on your brow.<br><br> <w>"Beryl, are you hiding in the closet? And why does the room stink of...sulfur…"</w><br><br> A look of realization seems to cross over her, but rather than anger or fear, she smiles.<br><br> <w><magic>"My,what</magic> a playful little game, with you <i>refusing</i> to come out of the closet like that."</w><br><br> <mc>"Heh, the better to surprise you."</mc> you think to yourself.<br><br> She steps forward, that smile growing playfully. You feel a breeze blowing past the closet doors against your face. Now is your chance! You burst from the closet to swing at her!<br><br> Except that you don't. Your arms spasm and your sword jerks, knocking the closet open wide, but despite all your efforts, your legs will not move.<br><br> <w>"I told you you'd <i>refuse</i> to leave the closet, magic can be very persuasive."</w> she stops drawing closer, but the devilish smile remains. Then her gaze drifts downward, <w>"Dangerous looking weapon you have there."</w><br><br> Your grip tightens around your sword, <mc>"the better to run you through with, Wytch!"</mc><br><br> <w>"Hardly what I meant, but you make a good point."</w> A look of concentration draws over her.<br><br> <w><magic>"My,what</magic> an impressive sword and suit of armor you have. Too bad you <i>forgot</i> to bring them."</w><br><br> Something about her words...unnatural...commanding. Not just commanding you, but as the phrase echoes in the small room, she seems to be commanding reality itself.<br><br> [[Change|ChangeFirst]] </div></div><<set $return = "ChangeFirst">> <<set $accHood = '<img src="resources/avatar/magic.png" />'>> <<set $faceMood = 'shocked.png'>> <<set $miscpic = {type:'vid', src: 'bedroom/day.mp4'}>> <<display "MISC">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/work.png"><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/smirk.png"></div> A cold wind blows over you, slowly growing in strength. As it blows stronger, you hear your armor buckle and creak. Suddenly, impossibly, it starts to dissolve, as if it were made of nothing but sand. The "grains" of your sword and armor are picked up in the otherworldly wind, swirling around you before disappearing entirely. In seconds, you are left in your underclothes, standing frozen before the Wytch.<br><br> The blood drains from your face. She has you trapped, defenseless. For the first time in a very long time, you begin to feel real fear.<br><br> <w>"Looks like I guessed right, handsome. You are well armed."</w><br><br> You cover your body as much as you can, your face burning in anger and embarrassment. <mc>"You'll never best me, demon!"</mc><br><br> <w>"No, I’m sure I haven’t got a chance against you,"</w> she says, rolling her eyes. <w>"Well, until you "best" me, whatever shall we do with you?"</w> She sits on the edge of the bed to ponder...almost getting within arms reach.<br><br> <w>"You need some kind of punishment. You broke into my house, tried to kill me, and banished my lover. Do you know how hard they are to summon? I don't even know where I put her phallactary."</w><br><br> <mc>"The world is better off with one less succubus monster."</mc><br><br> <w>"Oh she wasn't hurting anybody! Aside from fucking, she spent most of her time lounging in bed. Barely cooked and never cleaned...this place is a complete mess and I..."</w> she pauses mid-sentence, a smile returning. <w>"I think I've decided your punishment."</w><br><br> She stands up again, looking somehow imperious in her decision, <w><magic>"My,what</magic> a kind, obedient servant you are. Always trying to please your mistress. And you would <i>never</i> try to harm her."</w><br><br> That feeling of a cold breeze again blows past your face, raising goose-bumps and ruffling your hair.<br><br> <w>"What's your name?"</w><br><br> You don’t want to tell her, but the words fall out regardless, <mc>"Jacob, they call me the Blackwolf."</mc><br><br> She snickers a little, <w>"Alright, then Blackwolf. They come with pitchforks and torches, or worse hunters and mercenaries."</w> She's obviously upset, punctuating that last point with a glare at you.<br><br> You think about it a moment, as the weight of your profession comes to bear on you. It's a very lonely life."</w><br><br> She can't seem to bring herself to look at you, instead staring into the fireplace. You wonder, is that the real reason you're here? You pull out a bowl and set it in front of her, but you keep your eyes defiant and neglect to add any soup.<br><br> This sets her off even more, <w>"I don't know what to do with you, $nicknameS! I just...you know what, I'm done. I'm done even trying with you."</w><br><br> You wonder what she means when you feel her magic begin to flow around you.<br><br> <w><magic>"My what</magic>an obedient little slave you are. You will do everything I ask without complaint, and from now on, you will only refer to me as Mistress."</w><br><br> <<set $MissNic = "Mistress">> You feel her magic wash over you again. Nothing changes physically, but you know all too well what she's done. You shudder internally - not sure if it's from the magic or from realizing what's just happened.<br><br> She sits for a moment to let herself calm down. When she finally reaches room temperature again, she coolly looks at you and says, <w>"Dinner."</w><br><br> No longer able to disobey or even say something back, you serve her a bowl of soup. You go to fill a bowl for yourself when you hear her speak, <w>"No, you will wait silently for me to finish."</w><br><br> Turning back, she still isn't even looking at you, and you realize you have no choice. You obediently stand next to her while she eats.<br><br> She takes her time with it, but the bowl eventually dwindles down to the bottom.<br><br> She stands up and finally looks at you again, her voice calm but icy cold. <w>"You may eat, then clean the dishes. You sleep down here from now on."</w><br><br> With that, she turns and heads upstairs. You hear the bedroom door close and are left with an empty room, a worried feeling, and a cold bowl of soup.<br><br> <<link "Go to sleep" "SleepDown">><</link>> </div></div><<set $faceMood = "annoyed.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<set $fire.done = false>> <<set $cleanup.done = false>> <<display "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> Despite your imprisonment being worse off than before, you feel like you've finally gotten through to her that you will not be broken and bent to her will. That's the trouble though, whether or not you can escape. I'm tired of cleaning this damned house, eating this damned stew, and washing your damned clothes, and especially looking more like I fit into those clothes better every day!"<mc><br><br> You expect her to yell back at you, but instead, she starts laughing out loud. <w>"Wait, did you actually try on my clothes?"</w><br><br> You were just venting, and the thought hadn't occurred to you yet. For a moment the idea dances through your brain before you shut it out. You can feel your cheeks turning red with anger and embarrassment. Eventually, her laughter simmers down, <w>"Thanks, I needed that, $nicknameS.If you feel the desire, you're free to try on my things. Some of them might just fit you now. Just be careful not to rip anything trying to get it on."</w><br><br> She pauses for a moment to regain her composure, <w>"In any case, regardless of what you're wearing, I still expect better work from you in the future."</w><br><br> </div></div><<set $storymode = true>> <<if $sleepDown == true>> <<set $fire.done = false>> <<set $cleanup.done = false>> <<display "INT">> <<else>> <<set $miscpic = {type:'pic', src: 'bedroom/night.png'}>> <<display "MISC">> <</if>> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <cap>$MissNic</cap> was not wrong, you had been getting along well for a while. Her look only makes you angrier.<br><br> <mc>"Trying at what? At cleaning your damned house? At acting like a happy slave? Or at being your cute little dress-up experiment?"</mc><br><br> For one of the first times since you've met her, she seems to be without a snappy comeback, <w>"That's not what I meant, what I wanted was…"</w><br><br> You cut her off, <mc>"What you wanted? I don't care what you want. I don't want to be trapped here, I don't want to serve you, and I don't want to be ripped up and remolded every day!"</mc> By this point, you're standing up and yelling quite forcefully.<br><br> She rises to meet you, literally, standing up at her end of the table. <w>"You know what, I don't care what you want either! You're arrogant and stubborn, and those are your best traits. You carve your way through magical creatures without a care for them having thoughts, emotions, families or being living creatures. You deserve far worse than what I've given you."</w><br><br> Her eyes are flaring with anger, but also welling up with tears, <w>"You're so ungrateful, I've given you a second chance at life - a do-over most mortals can only dream of, and you spend the entire time wallowing in self-pity!"</w><br><br> You start to speak, but it's her turn to cut you off, <w>"No, I've wasted enough words and enough magic on you. I'm going upstairs, you can sleep down here."</w><br><br> <<link "Go to sleep" "SleepDown">><</link>> </div></div> <<set $decision = "Dinner-FrustratingDecision">> <<set $dinnerUp = "Dinner-Improving">> <<set $dinnerDown = "Dinner-GoneTerrible">> <<set $dinnerThis = "">> <<set $relLvl = -1>> /* Relationship Levels: -2 terrible, -1 bad, 0 neutral, 1 good, 2 great */ <<set $faceMood = "annoyed.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<if $sleepDown == true>> <<set $fire.done = false>> <<set $cleanup.done = false>> <<display "INT">> <<else>> <<set $miscpic = {type:'pic', src: 'bedroom/night.png'}>> <<display "MISC">> <</if>> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> This isn't the first time $MissNic's mentioned how much worse things could be for you. In a panicked rush you return the book and head downstairs.<br><br> <<set $newDay = true>> <<link "Downstairs" "Review">><</link>> <<else>> <<if $woodsmanOn == true && $woodsmanDone == false && $time <= $halfTime>> <<link "Finish reading" "Woodsman">><</link>> <<else>> <<link "Finish reading" $return>><</link>><br> <<link "Keep reading (30)" "Book">><</link>> <</if>> <</if>> <<case 4>> You open the book to the next chapter, finally getting some traction on where wytch magic comes from.<br><br> The book explains that magic is a natural part of everyone - as much as blood and bone - and is the animus to life. During sex, men pass their their magic on to their partners. Most women are unaware of this extra magic in their bodies and use it naturally and unconsciously to create life, as Eve did; or they simply let it pass back into the earth. But for those few touched by the powers of Adam, they can learn use the magic as Adam did - by speaking change into the world.<br><br> However, the book warns, invoking the powers of Adam will seal one off from the powers of Eve. Those that use the magic of change can never have children of their own.<br><br> The book's tone grows very serious here - warning about using magic on other people.<br><br> "Using magic on another can awaken the same powers in them. Used carelessly, this could unleash horrors upon the world or even lead to the end of humanity. <strong>Do not use your powers on others lightly.</strong>"<br><br> It goes on to explain why there are so few male wytches. It's partly due to the stigma against men having sex with each other, and partly due to them giving it away when they have sex. This also explains why wytches are so rare, they are very careful about using magic on other people - if they use magic on others, they might accidentally create more wytches!<br><br> <<if $awoken == 2 || $awoken == 4>> That's quite the revelation. You can now try practicing magic downstairs after cleaning the room.</npc> <</if>> <<case 5>> This time, you open the book with some excitement, looking forward to learning more about magic!<br><br> The next chapter goes into how to use magic.<br><br> Casting a spell is easy, the wytch simply invokes her words of power ($MissNic's seem to be "My what") and describes how she would like the thing to be. The universe will listen to the wytch and her subject and make it so.<br><br> Casting a spell <i>correctly</i> however is very hard. The wytch must believe completely and wholly in their spell. She must see the change before it is done. If a wytch commands a rabbit to become a deer, even though her eyes, ears, and nose all scream that there is a rabbit in front of her, she must see, hear and smell a deer.<br><br> This makes small changes simpler. If a woman has short black hair, it's relatively easy to picture her with long black hair. Picturing her with red hair is more difficult. Picturing her bald is more difficult still, as you must wholly create the shape of her head in your mind first.<br><br> <<if $change > 3>>That example stings a little, as you think of your own changes. Is that why $MissNic has been changing you gradually?<br><br><</if>> You read onward. The book warns again against using magic carelessly. Monsters of the imagination can become all too real. It even speculates that many of the monsters of the world - many of which you have fought - may have been created by untrained wytches. Ghosts might be incomplete resurrections, ogres might be misguided spells of strength and power.<br><br> You shudder at the thought. You can understand why $MissNic is careful about her magic.<br><br> Again you've gone and spent more time than intended reading. You carefully close the book, the dangers and weight of the magical world feeling heavy on your shoulders.<br><br> <<set _readTime = $time - 30>> <<if _readTime <= 0>> As you finish, you hear the telltale sound of footsteps coming up the path. On the one hand, it's opened your eyes to an entire new world of magic, but also to the horrors possible in that world. You're not sure if you want to be a part of it or not, but you are sure you want to know more.<br><br> The next chapter is on the limitations and dangers of magic.<br><br> As in the previous chapter, it goes to great pains to explain how one must be perfectly convinced of their power and invested in their spell. And how incomplete visualizations can lead to disastrous results.<br><br> In this chapter, it continues by explaining that it's not only the wytch who crafts the spell. When changing, the universe also listens to the target and what <i>they</i> imagine. For animals and inanimate objects with weak wills and imagination it's often a non-issue, but humans have wild imaginations and strong wills of their own.<br><br> If a wytch commands a person to be "strong", imagining well-built form, the person may end up only a little stronger, or as a hugely muscled adonis, depending on what they imagine by the word "strong".<br><br> <<if $escapeEventDone == true>> <mc>"My gods...this is it"</mc><br><br> Your mouth drops open as you suddenly realize the connection! Most know themselves all too well to imagine differently, so casting magic on oneself is nearly impossible and extremely dangerous.<br><br> You drop the book to your lap, mind blown by the revelations.<br><br> You close it slowly and stand up. You can feel everyone's eyes on your body as you strut across the wooden floor to the bar.<br><br> The bartender greets you with a nod and a smile.<br><br> <<if $bartenderFam == true>> <npc>"Well if it isn't everyone's favorite little redhead. Maybe the most use you can be to this world is as a cautionary tale…literally!"</w><br><br> You can feel the wind of her magic whipping up around you, but it's different this time - colder and darker then you've felt before. A chill runs down your spine as you realize this is likely the end for you.<br><br> <w>"<magic>My what</magic> a sad tale, little Red of Ridinghood and the trecherous Blackwolf that consumed her. Of course, I'm taking a little creative license when telling it - I hope you inspire future generations to live better lives than the one you've wasted."</w><br><br> You’re not really sure what she means, but you can already feel the changes starting. Your body is shrinking, reforming into something…else...something not human.<br><br> It's nearly instantanious, your body compresses, flattens and folds in on itself a hundred times over. In the briefest of moments, all that's left of you is a small book which tumbles to the floor.<br><br> The story of a little girl named Red from Ridinghiod, who went into the woods to meet a nice wytch, but was devoured by the anger of the Blackwolf.<br><br> It became quite popular - read the world over. Though she was also my mentor, my friend, and much more."</w><br><br> You study the tiny image, it's an intricately rendered painting of a regal-looking woman with piercing green eyes and bright, strawberry-red hair. <<if $sketchbook.have != 0>>Moreover, you recognize the painting style as $MissNic's from her sketchbook - she painted this.<</if>><br><br> <mc>"She must have meant a lot to you."</mc><br><br> <w>"Yes…she literally saved my life when she woke me up to magic."</w><br><br> <mc>"Saved you? Were you a slave or a criminal or something?"</mc><br><br> <w>"Oh no,"</w> she exclaims with a chuckle, <w>"nothing so dramatic or cliche as that. My family was actually quite well off. Not nobility, but my father was a very wealthy merchant. I was his only daughter. I was pampered, tutored, and doted on hand and foot."</w><br><br> You snerk at that with an eye roll, <mc>"Oh how horrible. Thank goodness you were rescued."</mc><br><br> She shoots you a glare and frown. <w>"Yes, I am thankful. You have no idea the life of a wealthy woman. We are raised without a care in the world, without any worry or responsibility - the most comfortable hell you can imagine. How would you feel if you had no say in where you lived, what you eat, how you speak and dress, who you fuck, who you marry? Women in that world are not people, we're trophies. Would you want such a life?"</w><br><br> You're taken aback, both by her old life and the passion she speaks about it. Moreover, you agree completely. You wouldn't want to be chained to a husband - even if the chain was made of gold. <mc>"You're right, I couldn't stand that life. I wasn't rich or pampered, grew up as a farmhand, but I couldn't let my whole world be a single farm. I first started hunting just to get away from the fields."</mc><br><br> <w>"I thought so, from the first conversation we had, I thought you were like me. There's so much in the world to see, to taste, to <i>feel</i>! I hope you remember that out in the world."</w><br><br>" You raise an eyebrow, <mc>"I'd try, but first I'd have to actually be...you know, free."</mc><br><br> <w>"Yes yes, touche. This isn't a life sentence, you're only here as long as you need to be...or choose to be. Just as it was for me."</w><br><br> Your eyebrow jumps up a little further in curiosity, <mc>"What does that mean?"</mc><br><br> Her usual smirk comes back, <w>"It's getting late, let's leave it there for now. Tell you what, you keep the locket for now, as a reminder that this can all be a positive experience. Trust me on that."</w><br><br> With that, she stretches and heads upstairs for the night. I knew it!"</npc> as he moves, you catch the glint of a blade from behind the door! Combat instinct kicks in and you sidestep his his first lunge at you.<br><br> You spin off your dodge in a fluid motion and rush forward to shove him off balance. Hopefully that will give yourself a chance to explain, or at least escape.<br><br> This time however, your instincts fail you. You learned your combat moves when you were much larger and much, much stronger - you push against him with all your weight and it does nothing!<br><br> It's like pushing against a stone wall!<br><br> The hunter takes the advantage to grab and slam you - painfully - against the door.<br><br> You cry out in desperation as he raises his sword to finish you off, <mc>"I'm her servant! Why were you so shy about it, did you think he was cute?”</w><br><br> <mc>”Yes!”</mc> your face burns even redder as you answer.<br><br> <w>”Well, well, well, who knew you had a type?”</w> she laughs and ruffles your hair before heading upstairs for the night.<br><br> <mc>”I don't have a type!”</mc> you shout after her.<br><br> You realize a moment later that you were under a truth compulsion when you answered yes…is he your “type” afterall?<br><br> <<if $dessert == true>> You don’t get long to think about it as $MissNic calls you from upstairs, <w>”If you’re done dreaming, there’s a tall, red, and hot one waiting for you up here.”</w><br><br> <<set $WytchSatisfaction = 0>> <<link "Upstairs" "Dessert">><</link>> <<else>> You shove the thoughts from your mind as you get on with the dishes.<br><br> <<link "Go upstairs to sleep" "SleepUp">><</link>> <</if>> </div></div><<set $faceMood = "sad.png">> <<set $storymode = true>> <<display "INT">> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> <div class="wytchNpc"><<print '<img src="resources/npcs/wytch/' + $wytchWear + '.png"/>'>><img src="resources/npcs/wytch/faces/smirk.png"></div> <<set $rel += 0>> <<if $hunterWarn < 1>> <<set $hunterWarn = 1>> <mc>"There's a new hunter in town!"</mc> you blurt out, not sure how to put it any more delicately.<br><br> She stops, the smile drifting away from her face. <w>"Oh, well that is some big news."</w><br><br> <<else>> <mc>"I have a little more information on the hunter."</mc><br><br> Her eyes light up, looking as if you'd offered her some juicy gossip, <w>"Well then, let's talk!"</w><br><br> <</if>> <<if $hunterTitle == "Ending" && $hunterRevealKnow != true>> <<set $hunterRevealKnow = true>> <mc>"Actually, I know him."</mc><br><br> <w>"You what!? Well this is a little awkward. Not to be rude to an old friend of yours, but is he any good?"</w><br><br> You sigh and bite your lip, unhappy to deliver the bad news, <mc>"He's not a friend, but he is good. His nickname is 'The Ending', he's...a specialist in hauntings and wytches."</mc><br><br> She rubs the bridge of her nose in frustration <w>"Damn it. I was hoping that if they lost one hunter, the village might just give up on sending another. I didn't know how dead-set they were on it. Honestly, I haven't even been to town in ages, I usually just send…"</w> she looks up at you suddenly, turning white in concern, <w>"Wait, did he see you?"</w><br><br> <<if $hunterConvo > 0>> <mc>"Um…kind of. I uh…talked to him."</mc> <<else>> <mc>"I don't think so, but I did follow him a little."</mc> <</if>><br><br> <w>"What? $nicknameS, don't you know how dangerous that is? He's hunting a red-haired wytch! Have you looked at yourself recently?"</w><br><br> <mc>"I was careful. Besides, I just <i>might</i> know a thing or two about hunters."</mc><br><br> <w>"Well, that's a…very good point actually,"</w> she acknowledges, relaxing a little crossing her arms, <w>"but still, a hunter is dangerous, and a prepared one…that's deadly. We have to take this very seriously, $nicknameS."</w><br><br> <</if>> <<if $hunterRitual == true && $hunterRitualKnow != true>> <<set $hunterRitualKnow = true>> <mc>"He's doing something called a "Focusing" ritual. It's an old hunter ritual of fasting and meditation, designed to protect one against magic. I didn't put much faith in it, though in hindsight, I probably should have."</mc><br><br> Her eyes widen at the news, <w>"That's…brilliant actually, you wouldn't be immune, but fasting would save up your magic, and meditation would focus your mind. Casting a spell on him would be very difficult. Terrifying, but brilliant."</w><br><br> <mc>"It's also the one bit of good news. The ritual takes quite a while. We have a little time before he's ready. $hunterDays, by my guess."</mc><br><br> <</if>> <<display "hunterchoices">> </div></div> <<for _i to 0; _i lt $dinnerConvo.length; _i++>> <<if $dinnerConvo[_i].name == "DinnerHunterSeen">> <<set $dinnerConvo.deleteAt(_i)>> <</if>> <</for>> <<set $dinnerThis = "">><<set $storymode = true>> <<if $sleepDown == true>> <<set $fire.done = false>> <<set $cleanup.done = false>> <<display "INT">> <<else>> <<set $miscpic = {type:'pic', src: 'bedroom/night.png'}>> <<display "MISC">> <</if>> <div class="storyhide"></div><div class="storytime"><div class="storytimeInner" tabindex="0"> You lay awake in bed, heavy thoughts running through your mind.<br><br> Another hunter! What does this mean?<br><br> Did the town give up on the Blackwolf? You hate to admit it to yourself, but you failed your task by nearly every measure. But why are they still hunting $MissNic? She doesn't seem to bother the town. Hell she hasn't even been there since she sends…<br><br> Your eyes shoot wide open. Oh shit, you go all the time, do they think you're the Scarlet Wytch now?<br><br> What to do?<br><br> <<link "Help $MissNic…you've come to care about her and don't want to see her hurt." I'm trying to help you."</mc><br><br> <w>"No, I meant I was worried to leave you, a RED-HAIRED girl, alone in the cabin of the Scarlet Wytch. The hunter wouldn't give you a chance to explain. You know that's true!"</w><br><br> You pause and drop your gaze, your false bravado draining away. She's right, hunters take payment, but their mission is to rid the world of monsters. And if the $hunterTitle's reputation is at all true, he takes that mission very seriously.<br><br> After a few moments of silence, $MissNic speaks up again, <w>"I have an idea…a proposal really. Sure it's a cozy little cabin, but what does Ridinghood have that you can't find in a hundred other little towns?"</mc><br><br> Her eyes flare in anger, <w>"maybe I'm just tired of upending my entire life every time a bunch of superstitious villages get wind of me living anywhere near!"</w><br><br> She turns away, looking at the fire. You don't answer right away - magic and your situation aside, she has had a tough life. You can't help but feel sympathy for her.<br><br> After a few moments she speaks again, <w>"That's…that's not true."</w><br><br> <mc>"What?"</mc><br><br> <w>"I'm sorry for the outburst. What's so special about it?"</mc><br><br> She smiles warmly at you, <w>"You, Red. You've turned this place into a home. You've helped me feel like I finally belong somewhere. When you found me, would you have listened if I told you I was just a peaceful wytch living alone in a cabin?"</w><br><br> Your face turns redder still, realizing she's right. <mc>"No, I wouldn't have. He's storing up his own magical energy - whether he knows it or not - and preparing his mind. Despite how tired you are, the swirling thoughts in your head keep you from sleeping.<br><br> Life is so strange. You've had many sleepless nights before a hunt. Preparing yourself to attack some monster somewhere…but now you're on the other side, wide awake and worrying about a hunter coming after you.<br><br> Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony.<br><br> You wonder if any of the creatures you'd hunted ever felt this way. Hunters go after creatures bigger and stronger than humans, so you'd never really thought they had reason to be scared…but then, you defeated all of them.<br><br> Well, almost all of them. You look over at $MissNic, gently breathing in her sleep, the covers slowly rising and falling over her voluminous chest.<br><br> You don't look at her, or monsters the same way anymore. But he might just believe me anyway…I mean, I don't know where you go to <i>recharge</i>,"</mc> you smile, teasing her for once.<br><br> <w>"Oh gods, $nicknameS. I don't have the highest standards, but I have <i>some</i> standards!"</w> <<if $relLvl > 0>>she shoves you playfully as you both giggle away the evening.<</if>><br><br> <<if $dessert == true>> Eventually dinner finishes. You easily dodge low, out of the angle of his ax, and aim the broom handle up towards his neck.<br><br> His own momentum makes it a solid hit, wrenching his head sideways and knocking his helmet clean off.<br><br> Disoriented, he plows right into a bookshelf with a wall-shaking crash. You hear a groan from under the pile of books and wood as he scrambles back to his feet.<br><br> Suddenly the air next to you shimmers and $MissNic appears out of nowhere!<br><br> <w>"<magic>My what</magic> a shame you can't move!"</w><br><br> The hunter freezes in place, still as a statue.<br><br> <<if $hunterWarn > 0>> <w>"Told you I'd be here, $nicknameS."</w> $MissNic says proudly, <w>"you have NO idea how difficult an invisibility spell is!"</w><br><br> <<else>> <w>"Men, so predictable."</w><br><br> <</if>> You only half listen, focused on the unmasked face of the hunter. Large, thick and veiny. You realize he's not going to take no for an answer.<br><br> After weeks of imprisonment, humiliation, anger, now this. Something inside you snaps. If you can't beat them, afterall, maybe it's better to join them.<br><br> As your rage dissapates, it's replaced with a cold acceptance. There is only one way to escape. And that's to run.<br><br> You bolt up from the floor and out the door, leaving it all behind you. You hear the sounds of shouting behind you, unsure whether your escape gave $MissNic a chance or not.<br><br> You keep running, driven by fear and excitement to be free again.<br><br> You eventually reach Ridinghood, panting and exhausted, and hide among the river docks for days. Terrified that the hunter or a vengefull wytch might show up looking for you.<br><br> Neither ever come.<br><br> Eventually the need for food and lodging force you to rejoin society.<br><br> You're even able to get a job at the local tavern, where you're endlessly popular for your cute looks and wild stories about wytches, hunters, and monsters.<br><br> With nothing better coming to mind, you even keep your new nickname, "Little Red of Ridinghood".<br><br> Months pass, but eventually your curiosity and guilt get the better of you, and you sneak back up the mountain to the old cabin.<br><br> It looks completely abandoned. Plants overgrowing the doors and windows, dust and dirt covering everything inside.<br><br> You search, but aren't able to find any clues about what happened after you left...until you pass by the fireplace.<br><br> A tiny glint catches your eye. Sunlight filters softly through their branches to illuminate the small clearing that holds the little cabin. After the past few weeks, you've grown familiar with the sights and sounds, but they seem different now that you'll be leaving them behind. As you pass the chopping block, you run your hand along the smooth axe handle that you've gotten to know so well - and relish not having to pick it up ever again.<br><br> Reaching the edge of the yard, you take one last look at the little cabin. So serene and peaceful, it's hard to believe how such an unassuming little place completely changed your life. When she finally gives you enough slack to move, you look up into her eyes.<br><br> <w>"Red, you make me so happy."</w><br><br> You don't answer, instead kissing her deeply..<br><br> ---<br><br> Days, months, and years pass. You both stay happily together in the little cabin. Cassandra still ventures out to do her wytchy business and refill magic, but now you get to tag along for the "ride".<br><br> And with two incredibly hot red-heads, it never takes long to find some boys to ride. Of course, you both travel much further now to avoid suspicion, and try not to go to the same town too often.<br><br> When you're not off with Cassandra, you stay at the cabin as the housemaker - happily cleaning, cooking, and washing. Though it's much easier with magic - giving you plenty of time to visit the town. The locals eventually forget about the tales of the Scarlet Wytch as they get to know you, their cute little neighbor from up the mountain. After some time, they even accept you as one of their own.
